title: Rolling - 2 wheels - same speed different total KE

content.prompt: Wheels A and B have the same radius and roll without slipping on a horizontal surface. The translational speed and rotational kinetic energy of both wheels is the same. However, the total kinetic energy of Wheel A is greater than the total kinetic energy of Wheel B. Which of the following correctly describes Wheel A in comparison to Wheel B?

choices.label: Wheel A is more massive and on average, its mass is distributed closer to the wheel’s center.
Wheel A is more massive and on average, its mass is distributed farther from the wheel’s center.
Wheel A is less massive and on average, its mass is distributed closer to the wheel’s center.
Wheel A is less massive and on average, its mass is distributed farther from the wheel’s center.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
